idea-plugin.name: Git
idea-plugin.description:
Provides integration with Git.
  • Check out your source code from a Git repository
  • Browse, commit, push, pull, merge, view log, review pull requests, and much more
  • Dedicated item in the VCS menu and in the context menu

To configure, open Settings / Preferences and go to Version Control | Git.

registryKey.description: Use wrapper executable on Windows to support soft Git process cancellation.
Use blocking mode for git process output reader.
Enables legacy hack for git integration, when some messages from stderr are handled as if they came from stdout.

Bitmask to control git logging of the commands executed by the IDE. Specified as int.
 (0) 00000 - logging disabled
 (31) 11111 - all categories enabled
 (29) 11101 - the one you might want
 (1) 00001 - GIT_TRACE
 (2) 00010 - GIT_TRACE_PACK_ACCESS
 (4) 00100 - GIT_TRACE_PACKET
 (8) 01000 - GIT_TRACE_PERFOMANCE
 (16) 10000 - GIT_TRACE_SETUP

Adds "--full-history --simplify-merges" to git log arguments when retrieving history for a file. This may sometimes result in empty merges being shown in the file history. However, skipping this arguments hides some side branches if the end result is the same.

If set to true, the whole Git repository root will be refreshed after performing a Git operation. Otherwise only the affected files will be refreshed. Affects only a subset of Git operations. The option is needed to debug possible "incomplete VFS refresh" reports, if they appear.
Find cherry-picked commits not only looking at patches using 'git cherry' but also by matching commit author, author time and "cherry picked from commit <hash>" suffix.

Find cherry-picked commits not looking at patches using 'git cherry' but by matching commit author, author time and commit message. This allows to find commits that were cherry-picked with conflicts and without adding "cherry picked from commit <hash>" suffix. Requires "git.log.use.index.for.picked.commits.highlighting" set to true.

Number of threads to call git fetch in parallel.
 Set to 1 to execute sequentially.
 Set to -1 to use the number of CPU cores.
 Set to -2 to start as many threads, as there are repositories in the project.
 Set to -3 to start as many threads, as there are repositories, but not more than 2 * number of cores.
 By default, SSH supports up to 10 multiplexed connections, thus number of threads will be limited by 10 despite this value.
Use workaround for Native SSH support in Git. Batch file cannot properly handle arguments with newlines when used as SSH_ASKPASS.

Wrap 'git' process with 'setsid' for remote operations. This fixes issue with SSH_ASKPASS if IDE is executed from terminal or under DM/WM that pass system TTY from Xorg to GUI applications. IDEA-201054
Wrap 'git' process with 'setsid -w' for remote operations with WSL executable.
Run git process for WSL executables without wrapping into a shell command.
Run git process for WSL executables using login shell command.
Run git process for WSL executables using LANG detected from ENV.
Update ENV variables passed to the git executable context to match the ones used for the project (ex: python venv, ruby sdk).
Use 'GIT_OPTIONAL_LOCKS' env variable to avoid taking unnecessary locks in git. Ex: to avoid 'git status' to interfere with 'git rebase' process in terminal.
Show dedicated toolwindow for git merge conflicts
If enabled, Update Project for Git is followed by the list of commits, instead of the list of updated files.
Show staged and unstaged changes in gutter markers.
If set to a value > 0, load base contents for shelving in batches: by reading the given number of files at once. If set to -1, contents are loaded as usual, one by one.
If set to false, IDE will ignore configured WSL1 executables. See IDEA-242469
Search for available executables in WSL on Windows
Show toolwindow tab with stashes
Use 'git restore --staged --worktree --source=HEAD -- paths' instead of 'git reset --hard' to speed up worktree cleanup.
Do not record stage operations in the undo stack of the document
Navigate to the staging area content from diff instead of the local file
Deprecated. Use the option in the Commit tool window 'Options' menu. When no changes are staged, stage and commit all changes in the project
Persist branches panel tree state between restarts
If true, then tree nodes will be expanded on single click, otherwise expand as usual JTree
Do not inverse 'ours' and 'theirs' conflict sides during rebase
Max amount of entry to process from Git reflog to parse recently checkout branches
Max count of recently checkout branches to show (e.g. in branches tree popup)
Enable embedded pinentry application for unlock GPG private key while Git perform commit signing. For remote dev (unix backend) and WSL.
Time period (in minutes) between incoming commits checks.
Provide completion for fixup, squash and amend prefixes in commit message field
Use Log to collect Rebase Entries
Use Git log index to lookup commits by message in Search Everywhere
Detect HEAD relative reference while pushing up to selected commit to the current branch
Amount of time in minutes to check new Git version after IDE inactivity.\n -1 to disable check.
